Heading: Unspecified
Note: <Product> is related to <RelatedProduct> in a way that cannot be specified by another code value

Heading: Includes
Note: <Product> includes <RelatedProduct> (inverse of code 02)

Heading: Is part of
Note: <Product> is part of <RelatedProduct>: use for ‘also available as part of’ (inverse of code 01)

Heading: Replaces
Note: <Product> replaces, or is new edition of, <RelatedProduct> (inverse of code 05)

Heading: Replaced by
Note: <Product> is replaced by, or has new edition, <RelatedProduct> (inverse of code 03)

Heading: Alternative format
Note: <Product> is available in an alternative format as <RelatedProduct> – indicates an alternative format of the same content which is or may be available (is own inverse)

Heading: Has ancillary product
Note: <Product> has an ancillary or supplementary product <RelatedProduct> (inverse of code 08)

Heading: Is ancillary to
Note: <Product> is ancillary or supplementary to <RelatedProduct> (inverse of code 07)

Heading: Is remaindered as
Note: <Product> is remaindered as <RelatedProduct>, when a remainder merchant assigns its own identifier to the product (inverse of code 10)

Heading: Is remainder of
Note: <Product> was originally sold as <RelatedProduct>, indicating the publisher’s original identifier for a title which is offered as a remainder under a different identifier (inverse of code 09)

Heading: Is other-language version of
Note: <Product> is an other-language version of <RelatedProduct> (is own inverse)

Heading: Publisher’s suggested alternative
Note: <Product> has a publisher’s suggested alternative <RelatedProduct>, which does not, however, carry the same content (cf 05 and 06)

Heading: Epublication based on (print product)
Note: <Product> is an epublication based on printed product <RelatedProduct>. The related product is the source of any print-equivalent page numbering present in the epublication

Heading: POD replacement for
Note: <Product> is a POD replacement for <RelatedProduct>. <RelatedProduct> is an out-of-print product replaced by a print-on-demand version under a new ISBN (inverse of code 17)

Heading: Replaced by POD
Note: <Product> is replaced by POD <RelatedProduct>. <RelatedProduct> is a print-on-demand replacement, under a new ISBN, for an out-of-print <Product> (inverse of code 16)

Heading: Is special edition of
Note: <Product> is a special edition of <RelatedProduct>. Used for a special edition (German: Sonderausgabe) with different cover, binding, premium content etc – more than ‘alternative format’ – which may be available in limited quantity and for a limited time (inverse of code 19)

Heading: Has special edition
Note: <Product> has a special edition <RelatedProduct> (inverse of code 18)

Heading: Is prebound edition of
Note: <Product> is a prebound edition of <RelatedProduct> (In the US, a ‘prebound’ edition is ‘a book that was previously bound and has been rebound with a library quality hardcover binding. In almost all commercial cases, the book in question began as a paperback. This might also be termed ‘re-bound’) (inverse of code 21)

Heading: Is original of prebound edition
Note: <Product> is the regular edition of which <RelatedProduct> is a prebound edition (inverse of code 20)

Heading: Product by same author
Note: <Product> and <RelatedProduct> have a common author

Heading: Similar product
Note: <RelatedProduct> is another product that is suggested as similar to <Product> (‘if you liked <Product>, you may also like <RelatedProduct>’, or vice versa)

Heading: Is facsimile of
Note: <Product> is a facsimile edition of <RelatedProduct> (inverse of code 25)

Heading: Is original of facsimile
Note: <Product> is the original edition from which a facsimile edition <RelatedProduct> is taken (inverse of code 24)

Heading: Is license for
Note: <Product> is a license for a digital <RelatedProduct>, traded or supplied separately

Heading: Electronic version available as
Note: <RelatedProduct> is an electronic version of print <Product> (inverse of code 13)

Heading: Enhanced version available as
Note: <RelatedProduct> is an ‘enhanced’ version of <Product>, with additional content. Typically used to link an enhanced e-book to its original ‘unenhanced’ equivalent, but not specifically limited to linking e-books – for example, may be used to link illustrated and non-illustrated print books. <Product> and <RelatedProduct> should share the same <ProductForm> (inverse of code 29)

Heading: Basic version available as
Note: <RelatedProduct> is a basic version of <Product>. <Product> and <RelatedProduct> should share the same <ProductForm> (inverse of code 28)

Heading: Product in same collection
Note: <RelatedProduct> and <Product> are part of the same collection (eg two products in same series or set) (is own inverse)

Heading: Has alternative in a different market sector
Note: <RelatedProduct> is an alternative product in another sector (of the same geographical market). Indicates an alternative that carries the same content, but available to a different set of customers, as one or both products are retailer-, channel- or market sector-specific (is own inverse)

Heading: Has equivalent intended for a different market
Note: <RelatedProduct> is an equivalent product, often intended for another (geographical) market. Indicates an alternative that carries essentially the same content, though slightly adapted for local circumstances (as opposed to a translation – use code 11) (is own inverse)

Heading: Has alternative intended for different market
Note: <RelatedProduct> is an alternative product, often intended for another (geographical) market. Indicates the content of the alternative is identical in all respects (is own inverse)

Heading: Cites
Note: <Product> cites <RelatedProduct> (inverse of code 35)

Heading: Is cited by
Note: <Product> is the object of a citation in <RelatedProduct> (inverse of code 34)

Heading: Is signed version of
Note: <Product> is a signed copy of <RelatedProduct>. Use where signed copies are given a distinct product identifier and can be ordered separately, but are otherwise identical (inverse of code 38)

Heading: Has signed version
Note: <Product> is an unsigned copy of <RelatedProduct>. Use where signed copies are given a distinct product identifier and can be ordered separately, but are otherwise identical (inverse of code 37)

Heading: Has related student material
Note: <Product> is intended for teacher use, and the related product is for student use

Heading: Has related teacher material
Note: <Product> is intended for student use, and the related product is for teacher use

Heading: Some content shared with
Note: <Product> includes some content shared with <RelatedProduct>. Note the shared content does not form the whole of either product. Compare with the ‘includes’ / ‘is part of’ relationship pair (codes 01 and 02), where the shared content forms the whole of one of the products, and with the ‘alternative format’ relationship (code 06), where the shared content forms the whole of both products (code 41 is own inverse)

Heading: Is later edition of first edition
Note: <Product> is a later edition of <RelatedProduct>, where the related product is the first edition

Heading: Adapted from
Note: <Product> is an adapted (dramatized, abridged, novelized etc) version of <RelatedProduct> (inverse of code 44). For use in ONIX 3.0 only

Heading: Adapted as
Note: <Product> is the original from which <RelatedProduct> is adapted (dramatized etc) (inverse of code 43), For use in ONIX 3.0 only
